thread.title: Victim of Ivanka Trump's stalker wants to meet with her
thread.title_full: Victim of Ivanka Trump's stalker wants to meet with her | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.com Reporter
title: Victim of Ivanka Trump's stalker wants to meet with her

organizations.name: victim empowerment resource safety and education center

text:
A Los Angeles woman has requested a sit down with Ivanka Trump to discuss something they have in common, the man who stalks them.
The two women are connected through Nevada-native and diagnosed schizophrenic Justin Massler, 34, who has had a turn at stalking them both.
Lenoara Claire had a three-year restraining order served against Massler in November and in 2012 he admitted to terrorizing Trump for over two years, once threatening to kill himself in her jewelry store.
Claire, 36, 'The Trumps have the biggest platform in the world, and they haven't done anything for this bipartisan issue,' Claire, 36, told the New York Daily News .
'I would like to have a lunch with her. I would like to get our nails done,' she added.
Scroll down for video
Lenora Claire, pictured, wants to have a sit down with Ivanka Trump to discuss something that unites them, their stalker
Ivanka Trump (left) and Lenora Claire (right) are connected through Nevada-native and diagnosed schizophrenic Justin Massler, 34, who has had a turn at stalking both of them
Massler, who legally changed his name to Cloud Starchaser in 2016, set his sights on Claire after LA Weekly profiled her in May 2011 for their 'Best of LA' feature.
Claire first met the former prep school student turned drifter, who was out on bail after a Trump-stalking stint, when he showed up at her art gallery dressed in a spacesuit.
He admitted in 2012 to terrorizing Trump for over two years, once threatening to kill himself in her jewelry store
The celebrity-obsessed man, pictured, has believed at different times that he is Harry Potter, Jesus Christ, Roger Rabbit, Neo from 'the Matrix' and the Messiah
She wasn't concerned until he spoke to her, telling her that she looks like a cross between Jessica Rabbit and Leelo from 'The Fifth Element'. She told the Daily News that he said he was going to stalk her.
Claire is a subject on Saturday's stalking-themed episode of CBS 's '48 Hours,' which will feature a Facetime interview with her stalker.
Justin Massler in 2016; Lenoara Claire said a typical day begins when she wakes up to check the latest messages from him and track his location in relation to her based on an IP address
She said that the celebrity-obsessed man has believed at different times that he is Harry Potter, Jesus Christ, Roger Rabbit, Neo from 'the Matrix' and the Messiah. Over the six years he has slung thousands of nonsensical tweets, emails, Facebook messages and YouTube comments at her.
He has shared a rape fantasy about Claire involving hobbits, and frequent plots to kidnap her and harness her 'magical powers.' He even threatened to gas her with the Nazi pesticide Zyklon B when he found out she was Jewish.
Claire said she has never responded, but that the six-year-ordeal has wholly consumed her life.
A typical day for her begins when she wakes up to check Massler's latest messages and track his location from an IP address. His tone, which can be anywhere from reverent to violent, and his proximity to her in LA can completely control her mood for the day.
However, Claire has compassion for her stalker. 'He's really sick, he needs help and his family has failed him,' she told the Daily News.
Claire is a subject on Saturday's stalking-themed episode of CBS's '48 Hours,' which will feature a Facetime interview with her stalker
The '48 Hours' interview in early November helped police to locate Massler (pictured in court when he was arrested for stalking Ivanka Trump) in Utah, where they served him with Claire's three-year protective order
She finally went to the Los Angeles Police Department after Massler sent her casting-director boss a death threat in September 2015. Claire said officers 'mocked' her, suggesting she dye her hair and get off social media.
Given that he is homeless and has no known address, it was nearly impossible for Claire to deliver her stalker a restraining order.
However, the '48 Hours' interview in early November helped police to locate Massler in Utah, where they served him with Claire's three-year protective order.
She said she has not heard from him in the last two weeks.
Claire has a number of ideas to improve the system, and has drafted them into legislative proposals.
She even teamed up in early 2016 with Representative Adam Schiff (D-Calif, center), who presented her ideas to the Department of Justice. She also launched the nonprofit Victim Empowerment Resource Safety and Education Center with former '48 Hours' subject Peggy Farrell (left)
Pictured with Representative Schiff (left), Claire has a number of ideas to improve the system, and has drafted them into legislative proposals
She even teamed up in early 2016 with Representative Adam Schiff (D-Calif), who presented her ideas to the Department of Justice.
She also launched the nonprofit Victim Empowerment Resource Safety and Education Center with former '48 Hours' subject Peggy Farrell.
Claire would like to use her platform to inform people that stalking victims are not just the Kardashians and Trumps of the world, but actually number 7.5 million annually, according to the National center for Victims of Crime.
'It happens to real people who do not have the benefit of hiring security firms and living in gated communities,' she said to the Daily News.
'I'm a regular person that's had enough'.
